metadata.title: CVE-2022-48894 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iommu/arm-smmu-v3: Don't unregister on shutdownSimilar to SMMUv2, this driver calls iommu_device_unregister() from theshutdown path, which removes the IOMMU groups with no coordinationwhatsoever with their users - shutdown methods are optional in devicedrivers. This can lead to NULL pointer dereferences in those drivers'DMA API calls, or worse.Instead of calling the full arm_smmu_device_remove() fromarm_smmu_device_shutdown(), let's pick only the relevant function call -arm_smmu_device_disable() - more or less the reverse ofarm_smmu_device_reset() - and call just that from the shutdown path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48894` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
